attributes.additional_details: The BBC Hungarian Service was disbanded on 2006 on the basis that the mandate to support fledgeling democracy in  Central/Eastern Europe had expired. That judgement now appears premature. The OSCE observation team reported the April 2018 elections as characterised by 'intimidating and xenophobic rhetoric, media bias and opaque campaign financing constricted the space for genuine political debate'. Hungary now ranks bottom for democratisation on the Central Europe 'nations in transit' index.
attributes.background: Media freedom in Hungary has been severely curtailed since the Orbán government came to power in 2010.  There is no longer any significant opposition or independent newspaper or radio station in the country and online sources are vanishing fast. The consequences for democratic order are disastrous .

rejection.details:
The BBC is an independent body governed by a Royal Charter. Under the terms of that Charter, the BBC is operationally and editorially independent of government and there is no provision for the government to intervene in the BBC’s day-to-day operations. 

You might like to write to the BBC to make this suggestion.
